result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary Joseph Parent Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000 [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony - Polk County Case #13CF291 [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Counts 2 and 3 read-in and dismissed.
-Polk County Case #13CF291 consolidated.
-Consecutive.
-Court extends 5 days to confirm credit.
-Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Consecutive to:

superMiscConds.notes:
Payable through prison wages.
DNA surcharge.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Defendant subject to random and regular testing.
-Pay Supervision fees.
-Pay current child support.
-Obtain/maintain full time employment.
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-No Contact with the Victims.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Scobey. ADA:   Michael E. Nieskes   DF ATTY:  James H. Krave   DF:  Gary Joseph Parent appeared from jail.  Gretchen Meierotto from CSA Agent Hollister is also present.  Includes sentencing in 12CF340, 14CF99 and consolidated Polk County case 13CF291.  Called at 9:15 a.m. Court reviews file and notes order re: consolidation of Polk County Case 13CF29 - Felony Bail Jumping.  Court notes PSI includes 12CF340 and 14CF99. Victims rights have been complied with.  Atty Krave does not have any clarifications to the PSI.  Recommendations.  DE makes statement.  Court orders:  

12CF340:  3 Years 0 Months, I/C 1 Year  0 Months, E/S 2 Years 0 Months.
14CF99:    3 Years 0 Months, I/C 1 Year  0 Months, E/S 2 Years 0 Months, consecutive.
13CF291:  S/W  3 Years Probation, consecutive with conditions. Conditions of probation are:

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-DE subject to regular and random testing.
-AODA and any recommended treatment.
-Costs of supervision payable through prison wages.
-Restitution of $2612.77 to M. Hayes, $399 to M. Wink and, $3200.00 to J. Wink. Payable through prison wages.
-Pay current child support.
-Obtain/maintain full time employment.
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.-No contact with the victims.
-Eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
-DNA surcharge.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Scobey. ADA:   Michael E Nieskes   DF ATTY:  James H Krave   DF:  Gary Joseph Parent appeared from jail. Set for pre-trial. Includes 14CF340 and 14CF99. Cases called at 1:52 p.m. ADA Nieskes informs Crt of agreement. DE has pending cases in Polk County. Atty Krave makes statement re: consolidation. DE pleads guilty to Ct 1 in 12CF340 and pleads guilty to Ct 1 in 14CF99. DE sworn. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily, and knowingly makes plea. Attorneys stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 12CF340 and guilty of Ct 1 in 14CF99. On motion of the State, Cts 2, 3, & 4 in 12CF340 are read in and dismissed. Cts 2 & 3 in 14CF99 are read in and dismissed. Court orders PSI. Bail is revoked. DE remanded SCC jail  pending sentencing. Atty Krave addresses PSI. Crt sets for sentencing.  Arguments as to bond. Bond continues in form and amount.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 21, 2014 at 09:00 am.
for Transport. Signed by SRN on 6/19/2014. c: DA, cc: Missy, Fax: sheriff and Jail. km
mailed new bond to Def at Polk County Jail for signature on this date. km
Per SRN, mail bond to Polk County for signature. km
Filed by Atty Krave. Requesting the Court to reinstate the cash bond. Per SRN, if no objection reinstate cash bond - new bond to be prepared and signed. km

Filed by ADA Nieskes. km
Pre-trial conference on May 8, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Bond is to be Co-Signed by         SURETY NAME: Tracy Matzek

Includes 14CF99 & 12CF340

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Jordan and Michael W. or  Matthew H.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

Appr: CO: SRN, Rept. Kasten, Clerk: Gross, ADA:   Michael E. Nieskes   DF ATTY:  James H. Krave   DF:  Gary Joseph Parent appeared from jail.  INCLUDES: 12CF340 & 14CF99.  Case called: 3:05 p.m.  Atty Kraves makes statement to Court and gives status of Polk County Court.  Atty Krave requests bond modification to signature bond.  ADA Nieskes opposes bond modification w/out more information on where he will reside.  Ms. Matzek appears in Court and makes statement to Court.  DF will reside at S 209 Newman Ave in Spring Valley.  Court explains co-signature bond to Ms. Matzek.  Ms. Matzek agrees to sign bond.  Court amends bond.  Waive speedy trial.  gg  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
